TEXT: The applicant is a citizen of GPE of GPE ethnic origin , born in DATE . He currently resides in GPE . He is represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer working for ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s father was killed by the NORP Peace Keeping Forces ( IPKF ) in DATE . His elder brother , who was with ORG ) , has disappeared since DATE . The applicant ’s sister arrived in GPE in DATE and claimed asylum . On DATE the Special Adjudicator concluded that she had a well - founded fear of persecution and allowed her appeal . Reference was made in this decision to the applicant ’s own activity .

The applicant states that he was a member of ORG ( NORP ) from DATE . In DATE he expressed the wish to withdraw from the group , but its leaders prevented him from doing so and he was forced to stay . In DATE he tried to escape from the group ’s camp in ORG , but he was arrested and held at the camp as a prisoner . In DATE he managed to escape and fled to GPE . There he was arrested by the police because he had no identity card . While in detention his co - detainees recognised him as being a member of the NORP . Following that , he claims that he was tortured by police officers . He was detained for DATE ( from CARDINAL to CARDINAL DATE ) . Then he managed to escape with the help of his uncle who bribed some police officers . He was told he had to leave the country immediately because his life was in danger .

The applicant arrived in GPE on DATE and was arrested when trying to escape to GPE holding a false passport . On DATE , administrative decision ORG ordered the applicant ’s expulsion from GPE and his detention pending expulsion .
On DATE the applicant sought asylum . He identified himself under a false name because he feared for his safety if he had to return to GPE .

On DATE the Minister of Public Order rejected the applicant ’s request . On DATE the applicant appealed against this refusal . During the hearing before the competent administrative committee the applicant was assisted by an interpreter of NORP ethnic origin .

On DATE the Minister of Public Order concluded that the applicant had not established a well - founded fear of persecution within the meaning of the CARDINAL Refugee Convention and refused his application . This decision was served on the applicant on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant appealed against the decision of CARDINAL DATE ordering his expulsion . During the hearing before the competent administrative committee the applicant was assisted by an interpreter of NORP ethnic origin . His appeal was rejected on DATE . The applicant claims that he was informed of this decision orally on DATE .

In the meantime the applicant was informed about his sister ’s whereabouts . When he learned that his sister ’s request for asylum in GPE had been upheld , he made a new application for asylum on DATE .

His request was rejected on DATE . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE he lodged an appeal against this decision with ORG . He also applied for a suspensive effect of his appeal .
On DATE ORG ordered the temporary stay of execution of the administrative acts relating to the applicant ’s expulsion .
On DATE this decision was served on the applicant , who was then released and given a certificate stating that he remains in the country under tolerance .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of Law No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL provides that the Minister of Public Order may , in the public interest and if the person to be expelled is dangerous or there is a risk of him absconding , order his detention until his deportation from GPE becomes feasible .

CARDINAL . The application for annulment is the main remedy before ORG . This remedy is modelled on the NORP recours pour excès de pouvoir , and may be used to challenge both administrative action and inaction . The application for annulment may assert lack of competence , infringement of an essential procedural requirement , substantive violation of the law or abuse of discretionary power . A judgment for the petitioner declares the contested decision to be null and void erga omnes . The authorities are obliged to take the measures called for by the judgment , or to refrain from any action declared to be unlawful .
